Package chess.model

Class Chessboard

java.lang.Object
chess.model.Chessboard
All Implemented Interfaces:
chess.persistence.Codable, Iterable<Piece>
public class Chessboard extends Object implements Iterable<Piece>, chess.persistence.Codable
A class that represents a chessboard in a Chess game and manages the Chess pieces that are associated with it.

Simply, a chessboard is essentially a collection of Chess pieces, therefore it maintains no states other than the pieces.

This class implements all the core behaviors and operations of a chessboard, including but not limited to manipulating Chess pieces and providing insights to the current configuration of the chessboard.

Note: The chessboard is unaware of and has no access to the game that it is a part of.

  • Constructor Details

    • Chessboard

      public Chessboard(org.json.JSONObject jsonObject)
      Constructs a chessboard from a JSON object containing the following required key-value mappings: 
       {
     "active": [
         ...
     ],
     "captured": [
         ...
     ]
 }
      where both keys store a JSONArray, containing relevant Chess pieces.
      Parameters:
      jsonObject - The source JSONObject from which to decode.
      Throws:
      org.json.JSONException - If any of the required keys is missing or maps to a non-array value type.
      FormatException - Rethrown from Colored(JSONObject), or Piece.decode(JSONObject).
      NullPointerException - If jsonObject is null.
      See Also:
      • Piece.decode(JSONObject)

     ]
 }

    • clear

      public boolean clear()
      Clears this chessboard, i.e. removes all the Chess pieces of this chessboard.

      This method does nothing if there are no pieces on this chessboard.

      Returns:
      A boolean value indicating whether this chessboard started out empty.

    • placeWhite

      public Piece placeWhite(String pieceName, String position)
      Creates and places a White piece of the given type and position notation.

      The position notation must be of the pattern "^[a-h][1-8]$".

      Parameters:
      pieceName - The class name of the piece to be created (case-sensitive).
      position - The string notation of the piece's position.
      Returns:
      The White piece that was created.
      Throws:
      FormatException - If position is invalid.
      NullPointerException - If any of the arguments is null.
      IllegalArgumentException - If pieceName is invalid.
      See Also:
      • placePiece(String, Color, Position)

    • capturePiece

      public void capturePiece(Piece capturedPiece)
      Captures the given piece by performing the following:
      1. Removes the captured piece from the collection of active pieces;
      2. Adds the captured piece to the collection of captured pieces.
      Precondition: capturedPiece must exist on the chessboard and be active (i.e. not already captured).

      Note: This method is meant to be called by Capture only, for it requires the presence of the captured piece with absolute certainty.

      Parameters:
      capturedPiece - The piece to be captured.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If capturedPiece is null.
      NoSuchElementException - If capturedPiece does not exist on the chessboard or has already been captured.

    • undoCapturePiece

      public void undoCapturePiece(Piece capturedPiece)
      Undoes capturing the given piece by performing the following:
      1. Removes the captured piece from the collection of captured pieces;
      2. Adds the captured piece to the collection of active pieces.
      Precondition: capturedPiece must exist on the chessboard and be captured (i.e. not active), and the chessboard must not already have another piece at capturedPiece's position.

      Note: This method is meant to be called by Capture only, for it must be preceded by a call to capturePiece(Piece).

      Parameters:
      capturedPiece - The piece that was captured.
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - If capturedPiece does not exist on the chessboard or is already active.
      NullPointerException - If capturedPiece is null.

      public Optional<Piece> getPieceAt(Position position)

    • getPieceWith

      public Optional<Piece> getPieceWith(String identifier)
      Finds and returns the piece (active or captured) with the given identifier string.
      Parameters:
      identifier - A Version 4 UUID string.
      Returns:
      An optional piece with identifier, which is empty if no piece on this chessboard has identifier.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If identifier is null.

    • isInCheck

      public boolean isInCheck(Color color)
      A color is in check if and only if one of the opponent's non-King pieces can capture the color's King.
      Parameters:
      color - The color to be checked.
      Returns:
      A boolean value indicating whether the given color is in check.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If color is null.

    • isInCheck

      public boolean isInCheck(Colored colored)
      A Colored object is in check if and only if one of the opponent's non-King pieces can capture the object's King.
      Parameters:
      colored - The colored object to be checked.
      Returns:
      A boolean value indicating whether the color of colored is in check.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If colored is null.

    • stateGenerator

      public Iterator<chess.util.KeyValuePair<Movement,Chessboard>> stateGenerator(Color color)
      A more computationally-efficient version of the method getNextStates(Color) where the next states are generated on demand.
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      An iterable object that uses Chessboard.StateGenerator as its iterator.
